rules: Rule1: Provided that the manuscript is submitted to the journal, it does not get accepted.
Rule2: Either the manuscript is submitted to the journal or it is camera-ready.
Rule3: Whenever the manuscript is revised, it is edited.
Rule4: If the manuscript is edited, then it is proofread.
Rule5: Whenever the manuscript is proofread, it is published.
Rule6: If the manuscript meets the deadline, then the submission to the journal implies its acceptance.
Rule7: The manuscript meets the deadline or an extension is granted for it.
Rule8: Whenever the manuscript is corrected, it is retracted.
Rule9: Provided that the manuscript is reviewed blindly, its submission to the journal results in acceptance.
Rule10: If the manuscript is reviewed openly, then its submission to the journal implies acceptance.
Rule11: Under the condition that the manuscript is formatted, it becomes camera-ready.
Rule12: Provided that the manuscript is plagiarized, it is not original.
Rule13: Either the manuscript is plagiarized or it is formatted.
Rule14: If it is not the case that the assignment of an editor implies that an extension leads to submission resulting in acceptance, then the manuscript is desk-rejected.
Rule15: If it is not the case that the manuscript is reviewed blindly or openly, then it is rejected by the journal.
Rule16: Provided that it is not the case that the manuscript is reviewed blindly or openly, it does not get rejected by the journal.
Rule17: Under the condition that it is not the case that plagiarism implies originality, the manuscript is revised.
Rule18: Provided that the negation of the failure of editor assignment to entail extension leading to submission resulting in acceptance does not imply no desk rejection, the manuscript is corrected.
facts: Fact1: An editor is assigned to the manuscript.
Fact2: The manuscript is not retracted.
Fact3: The manuscript is not published.
